skills.name: Divide proper fractions in the form: Integer ÷ Fraction
Divide improper fractions in the form: Fraction ÷ Fraction
Divide mixed number fraction in the form: Integer ÷ Fraction
Divide mixed number fraction in the form: Fraction ÷ Fraction
Word problems involving dividing with or by unit fractions

explanations.A: It seems like you've just divided 16 by 1 here but we need to divide 16 by 1/2 exactly. Try writing 16 as 16/1 and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.
explanations.B: Not quite - you've multiplied by 1/2 instead of dividing by 1/2 here! Try writing 16 as 16/1 and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.
explanations.C: It seems like you may have done 'keep, change, flip' but changed the first fraction (16/1) instead of the second one.
explanations.D: If we write 16 as 16/1, we can do 'keep, change, flip' so that we have 16/1 x 2/1 which gives us 32/1, which is the same as just 32!

explanations.A: If we write 20 as 20/1, we can do 'keep, change, flip' so that we have 20/1 x 4/1 which gives us 80/1, which is the same as just 80!
explanations.B: It seems like you may have done 'keep, change, flip' but flipped the first fraction instead of the second one.
explanations.C: Not quite - you've multiplied by 1/4 instead of dividing by 1/4 here! Try writing 20 as 20/1 and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.
explanations.D: It seems like you've just divided 20 by 1 here but we need to divide by 1/4 exactly. Try writing 20 as 20/1 and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.

explanations.A: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.B: It looks like you may have divided by both the top and the bottom of the fraction but we can't do that - we need to do 'keep, change, flip' like we normally do for dividing fractions!
explanations.C: If we write 30 as 30/1 and do keep change flip, we have 30/1 x 3/2 which gives us 90/2. This simplifies to 45.
explanations.D: It seems like you've divided 30 by 1 here rather than 2/3 but we need to divide by the fraction exactly as it is. Try writing 30 as 30/1 and and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.

explanations.A: If we write 24 as 24/1 and do keep change flip, we have 24/1 x 3/2 which gives us 72/2. This simplifies to 36.
explanations.B: It seems like you've just divided by 1 here but we need to divide by 2/3 exactly. Try writing 24 as 24/1 and then using the usual rules for dividing fractions.
explanations.C: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.D: It looks like you may have divided by both the top and the bottom of the fraction but we can't do that - we need to do 'keep, change, flip' like we normally do for dividing fractions!

explanations.A: It seems like you've divided 18 by 4 and then divided 4.5 by 1/2. Mixed number division doesn't work like this - we need to change the mixed number into an improper fraction before we divide.
explanations.B: Read carefully! She needs to make 36 half-cup servings, which would be 18 cups of smoothie we are dividing by 4 and 1/2.
explanations.D: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!

explanations.A: It seems like you've divided by 3 and then just put the 1/2 on. Mixed number division doesn't work like this - we need to change the mixed number into an improper fraction before we divide.
explanations.B: It seems like you've divided by 3 and then by 1/2. Mixed number division doesn't work like this - we need to change the mixed number into an improper fraction before we divide.
explanations.C: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.D: 84 half-cup servings would be 42 cups. 3 1/2 is the same as 7/2. If we divide 42 by 7/2, we get 84/7 which simplifies to 12.

explanations.A: If we use the rule 'keep change flip', we end up with 21/2 divided by 2/3, which gives us 42/6. This simplifies to 7 if we do 42 divided by 6.
explanations.B: It seems like you may have just divided the top and the bottom of the fractions, however we can't do that for a division. We need to use the rule 'keep, change, flip'.
explanations.C: You're very close here, but see if you can try simplifying the fraction! How many 6s can go into 42?
explanations.D: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!

explanations.A: It seems like you may have just divided the top and the bottom of the fractions, however we can't do that for a division. We need to use the rule 'keep, change, flip'.
explanations.B: If we do keep, change, flip, that will give us 35/2 x 2/5 which is 70/10. That simplifies to 7 when we do 70 divided by 10.
explanations.C: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.D: You're very close here, but see if you can try simplifying the fraction!

explanations.A: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.B: 3 1/2 is the same as 7/2, which when divided by 1/4 would give us 7/2 x 4/1 which is 28/2. 28 divided by 2 is 14.
explanations.C: It seems like you have flipped the first fraction, however the rule is 'keep, change, flip' in that order!
explanations.D: Not quite - it seems like you might've multiplied 3 by 1 and added 2 when changing the mixed number. We multiply by the bottom and then add to the top.

explanations.A: It seems like you have flipped the first fraction, however the rule is 'keep, change, flip' in that order!
explanations.B: Not quite - it seems like you might've multiplied 5 by 3 and added 4 when changing the mixed number. We multiply by the bottom and then add to the top.
explanations.C: It looks like you may have forgotten the 'flip' in the fraction division rule 'keep, change, flip'!
explanations.D: 5 3/4 is the same as 23/4. If we do keep, change flip, that would give us 23/4 x 4/1, which is 92/4. This simplifies to 23 when we divide 92 by 4.
